thread.title: IPL-style football league to kick off in Ahmedabad in December
thread.title_full: IPL-style football league to kick off in Ahmedabad in December - The Times of India

author: Shweta Singh
title: IPL-style football league to kick off in Ahmedabad in December
text:
AHMEDABAD: Since the inception of Indian Premier League (IPL), cricket lovers in the city have been longing for a team of their own. The dream, however, remains unfulfilled.
The Amdavadis have now got the chance to have some fun on the football field. The city will soon have an IPL-style football league that promises to further popularize the sport in the city.
Juggernaut, the pioneers of small-team football (6-a-side), will launch Ahmedabad Champions League (ACL), the city's first 6-a-side football tournament.
A total of eight teams will vie for top honours in the inaugural edition of ACL that is set for the kick off on December 19.
"The league will be played at Juggernaut Arena which boasts of the first FIFA-approved turf in Ahmedabad. The ground size of 120 feetx70 feet is designed for 6-a-side football," said a press statement issued by the organisation.
Before the kick-off, the eight franchise owners will open up their purses to buy players through an auction to be held on December 1. Footballers from across the state will be part of a selection tournament that will be held between October 24 and November 22.
A pool of 100-120 best players will then be picked by the technical committee, which comprises three former footballers -- Sylvester D'Souza, Pias Abraham and Prakash Christian.
The players bought in the auction will have a three-year contract and will get salary during the period.
